intro: Lippia nodiflora var. normalis, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic, narrow leaves with a grayish-green color. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping. Its essential oils contain compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its aromatic and medicinal properties.
